text:
I installed Apache 2.0.43 on my computer at home (Windows 2000 Workstation 
SP3), where I use ZoneLabs ZoneAlarm (free version, 3.1.395) to protect it from 
external intruders.

I discovered that when stopping the Apache service, the service hangs, cannot 
be "killed", and after a few minutes the machine crashes (blue screen). If I 
disable ZoneAlarm, Apache works fine.

Here a snap from the error log:

[Mon Dec 23 20:06:51 2002] [notice] Parent: Created child process 896
[Mon Dec 23 20:06:51 2002] [notice] Child 896: Child process is running
[Mon Dec 23 20:06:51 2002] [notice] Child 896: Acquired the start mutex.
[Mon Dec 23 20:06:51 2002] [notice] Child 896: Starting 250 worker threads.
[Mon Dec 23 20:06:58 2002] [notice] Parent: Received shutdown signal -- 
Shutting down the server.
[Mon Dec 23 20:06:58 2002] [notice] Child 896: Exit event signaled. Child 
process is ending.
[Mon Dec 23 20:06:59 2002] [notice] Child 896: Released the start mutex
[Mon Dec 23 20:07:00 2002] [notice] Child 896: Waiting for 250 worker threads 
to exit.
[Mon Dec 23 20:07:28 2002] [notice] Parent: Forcing termination of child 
process 248 
[Mon Dec 23 20:10:00 2002] [notice] Child 896: Terminating 1878053824 threads 
that failed to exit.
[Mon Dec 23 20:10:00 2002] [notice] Child 896: All worker threads have exited.
[Mon Dec 23 20:10:00 2002] [notice] Child 896: Child process is exiting

Then the process hangs and there is no way to recover the machine.
There is that "Terminating 1878053824 threads that failed to exit." that 
concerns me a little!

I already told ZoneLabs of this problem, but I don't know yet if this is an 
Apache bug or a ZoneAlarm bug.
creator: cp@sandon.it
news@dennisheck.de
text:
Hi!
I experienced exactly the same problem. I'm running apache 2.0.43 downloaded 
from apache.org on win2k.
The system will hang up completly - only chance is to reset the machine - when 
I stop the Apache service during ZoneAlarm is active.

The problem does not ocur when running Apache 1.3 under same circumstances, so 
I expect it to be a matter of Apache2.

Anyone got a solution for this bug?

creator: wrowe@apache.org
text:
No fix forthcoming here... Apache 2.0 uses more sophisticated WinSock features 
  than 1.3 did, which is why you don't see this bug in ZoneAlarm using 1.3.


*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 7932 ***
